**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
PVC created from a ceph rbd snapshot in the `default` namespace forever remains in `Pending` state.

**Expected behavior:**
PVC that is created from a snapshot should be successfully `Bound` as [documented](https://rook.io/docs/rook/v1.2/ceph-csi-drivers.html). Note that this works with rook 1.1.7 on the same setup.

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
Checkout the rook release-1.1 Git branch or use rook version 1.1.8, then follow the steps in the [Documentation](https://rook.io/docs/rook/v1.2/ceph-csi-drivers.html). Note that the issue also occurs with rook 1.2.0.

**File(s) to submit**:

* Cluster CR (custom resource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary
Unmodified `cluster-test.yaml` is being used here.
* Operator's logs, if necessary
* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary
PVC status:
```
$ kubectl get pvc
NAME              STATUS    VOLUME                                     CAPACITY   ACCESS MODES   STORAGECLASS      AGE
rbd-pvc           Bound     pvc-d6635ace-0949-43ca-9e02-072d602650a7   1Gi        RWO            rook-ceph-block   70m
rbd-pvc-restore   Pending                                                                        rook-ceph-block   70m
```

`rbd-pvc-restore` PVC log excerpt:
```  Type     Reason                Age                     From                                                                                                        Message
  ----     ------                ----                    ----                                                                                                        -------
  Normal   Provisioning          3m12s (x10 over 7m50s)  rook-ceph.rbd.csi.ceph.com_csi-rbdplugin-provisioner-54cc7d5848-rtsmd_4b7e3884-f040-4b29-a5c3-c2cb5bea1b9f  External provisioner is provisioning volume for claim "default/rbd-pvc-restore"
  Warning  ProvisioningFailed    3m10s (x10 over 7m47s)  rook-ceph.rbd.csi.ceph.com_csi-rbdplugin-provisioner-54cc7d5848-rtsmd_4b7e3884-f040-4b29-a5c3-c2cb5bea1b9f  failed to provision volume with StorageClass "rook-ceph-block": volume content source missing
  Normal   ExternalProvisioning  2m2s (x26 over 7m50s)   persistentvolume-controller                                                                                 waiting for a volume to be created, either by external provisioner "rook-ceph.rbd.csi.ceph.com" or manually created by system administrator
```
`csi-provisioner` Docker log excerpt:
```

I0107 14:32:54.944629       1 connection.go:180] GRPC call: /csi.v1.Controller/CreateVolume
I0107 14:32:54.944639       1 connection.go:181] GRPC request: {"capacity_range":{"required_bytes":1073741824},"name":"pvc-fe2d393b-c44e-42fc-910e-2943c68da771","parameters":{"clusterID":"rook-ceph","imageFeatures":"layering","imageFormat":"2","pool":"replicapool"},"secrets":"***stripped***","volume_capabilities":[{"AccessType":{"Mount":{"fs_type":"ext4"}},"access_mode":{"mode":1}}],"volume_content_source":{"Type":{"Snapshot":{"snapshot_id":"0001-0009-rook-ceph-0000000000000001-b196096c-3153-11ea-8753-36d32e3dab18"}}}}

I0107 14:32:56.239494       1 connection.go:181] GRPC request: {"secrets":"***stripped***","volume_id":"0001-0009-rook-ceph-0000000000000001-97b407a3-315a-11ea-8753-36d32e3dab18"}
I0107 14:32:57.350657       1 connection.go:183] GRPC response: {}
I0107 14:32:57.351470       1 connection.go:184] GRPC error: <nil>

W0107 14:32:57.351571       1 controller.go:887] Retrying syncing claim "fe2d393b-c44e-42fc-910e-2943c68da771", failure 18
E0107 14:32:57.351603       1 controller.go:910] error syncing claim "fe2d393b-c44e-42fc-910e-2943c68da771": failed to provision volume with StorageClass "rook-ceph-block": volume content source missing
I0107 14:32:57.351647       1 event.go:255] Event(v1.ObjectReference{Kind:"PersistentVolumeClaim", Namespace:"default", Name:"rbd-pvc-restore", UID:"fe2d393b-c44e-42fc-910e-2943c68da771", APIVersion:"v1", ResourceVersion:"15534", FieldPath:""}): type: 'Warning' reason: 'ProvisioningFailed' failed to provision volume with StorageClass "rook-ceph-block": volume content source missing
```

That following [commit](https://github.com/rook/rook/commit/319b2d211267cf39abbad089a93c22619863c360) (updated CSI sidecar images) might be related to the issue. The "volume content source missing" error message got introduced with the following [commit](https://github.com/kubernetes-csi/external-provisioner/pull/283) for the csi-provisioner sidecar.

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
CentOS 7
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
3.10.0-957.12.2.el7.x86_64
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
1 master, 2 worker nodes, all KVM VMs
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod):
rook: v1.1.8
go: go1.11
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`):
ceph version 14.2.4 (75f4de193b3ea58512f204623e6c5a16e6c1e1ba) nautilus (stable)
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
1.16.3
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift):
Plain k8s, installed using kubeadm
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)):
HEALTH_OK
title: Rook/Ceph CSI 1.1.8 and later: Restore snapshot to PVC is pending forever
